Citation.Paragraph: belonging to the tribe Dacetonini in the subfamily Myrmicinae, is represented by 167 described species distributed in all zoogeographical regions from the tropical to the temperate zones of the world (Bolton, 1995

Citation.Paragraph: Modern taxonomic under- standing of Strumigenys depends almost entirely upon the works by Brown (1948

Citation.Paragraph: The first description of Taiwanese Strumigenys was that of Forel (1912
Citation.Name: Forel

Citation.Paragraph: Brown raised Forel's variety to species status, S. formosensis. Recently, Terayama and Kubota (1989
Citation.Name: Terayama and Kubota

Citation.Paragraph: described 2 new species, S. mintula and S. liukueie- nsis, and recorded S. solifontis for the 1st time. Thus 4 species of the genus have hitherto been found in Taiwan. A key to the Taiwanese species of Strumigenys was also provided by Terayama and Kubota (1989
